title: The Populist Movement
subtitle: Farmers Organize (1890s)

sections.title: Drowning in Debt
sections.summary: I'm Emma, sixteen years old, and I live on a wheat farm in Kansas. My family works from sunrise to sunset planting, tending, and harvesting wheat. We work harder every year.

sections.title: The Farmers' Alliance
sections.summary: Farmers across the country are organizing. The Farmers' Alliance starts in Texas and spreads across the South and West. By 1890, it has over a million members.

sections.title: The People's Party
sections.summary: In 1892, the Farmers' Alliance forms a political party: the People's Party, also called the Populist Party. At the founding convention in Omaha, Nebraska, we adopt a platform demanding sweeping reforms. The preamble is radical: "We meet in the midst of a nation brought to the verge of moral, politic...

sections.title: The Cross of Gold
sections.summary: 1896. The presidential election focuses on the money question: gold standard or free silver? Republicans nominate William McKinley, who supports the gold standard.

sections.title: Defeat and Legacy
sections.summary: November 1896. McKinley wins. He carries the Northeast, Midwest, and urban areas.
